accountID.description: AccountID is the cloud account ID.

attackTechniques.description: AttackTechniques are the MITRE attack techniques.

cluster.description: Cluster is the cluster where the audit took place.

collections.description: Collections are collections to which this audit applies.

effect.description: Effect is the rule effect which was applied to the review which led to this audit.

kind.description: Kind is the type of object being manipulated. For example: Pod.

message.description: Message is the rule user defined message which appears on audit.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace associated with the request (if any).

operation.description: Operation is the operation being performed.

rawRequest.description: RawRequest is the original review request that caused this audit.

resource.description: Resource is the name of the resource being requested.  This is not the kind.  For example: pods.

ruleName.description: RuleName is the name of the rule which issued this audit.

time.description: Time is the time at which the audit was generated.

userGroups.description: UserGroups is the names of groups this user is a part of.

userUid.description:
UserUID is a unique value that identifies this user across time. If this user is
deleted and another user by the same name is added, they will have
different UIDs.

username.description: Username is the name that uniquely identifies this user among all active users.

admission.Policy.description: Policy represents a policy enforced on Kubernetes admission reviews

rules.description: Rules is a list of rules associated with the admission policy.

attackTechniques.description: AttackTechniques are the MITRE attack techniques.

disabled.description: Indicates if the rule is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

modified.description: Datetime when the rule was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or last modified the rule.

previousName.description: Previous name of the rule. Required for rule renaming.

skipRawReq.description: SkipRawReq signals to exclude raw review request in a resulting admission audit.

api.AlertClientType.description: AlertClientType represents the type of alert client (e.g., email, slack, ...)

api.AlertProfile.description: AlertProfile represents an alert profile (event type and recipients)

_id.description: ID is the alert profile ID.

disabled.description: Indicates if the rule is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

external.description: External indicates that the profile is integrated through Prisma Cloud.

integrationID.description: IntegrationID is the ID identifying the provider configured in Prisma Cloud.

lastError.description: LastError represents the last error when sending the profile.

modified.description: Datetime when the rule was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or last modified the rule.

policy.description: Policy contains the mapping between alert type to the applied alert rules.

previousName.description: Previous name of the rule. Required for rule renaming.

vulnerabilityImmediateAlertsEnabled.description: VulnerabilityImmediateAlertsEnabled indicates whether an immediate vulnerability alert will be sent upon new image scan.

api.AlertProfileCortexSettings.description: AlertProfileCortexSettings represents Cortex applications alert profile settings

caCert.description: CACert is the certificate used to verify the server.

credentialId.description: CredentialID is the id of the basic authentication credential.

enabled.description: Enabled is Webhook provider enabled/disabled indicator.

json.description: Json is the custom json we send to the url.

api.AlertProfileEmailSettings.description: AlertProfileEmailSettings represents the alert profile Email settings

credentialId.description: CredentialID is the Email authentication credentials id.

from.description: From is the from address of the mail.

labels.description: Labels are custom label names from which the mail recipients are extracted, allowing to dynamically extract the target of the alerts.

api.AlertProfileGcpPubsubSettings.description: AlertProfileGcpPubsubSettings is the GCP Pub/Sub alert profile settings

credentialId.description: CredentialID is the GCP Pub/Sub authentication credentials id.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates whether the GCP Pub/Sub settings are enabled.

topic.description: Topic is the GCP Pub/Sub topic (used by subscribers to listen for messages).

api.AlertProfileJIRASettings.description: AlertProfileJIRASettings represents the alert profile JIRA settings

caCert.description: CACert is the certificate used to verify the server.

credentialId.description: CredentialID is the JIRA authentication credentials id.

enabled.description: Enabled controls whether the rule is enabled.

issueType.description: IssueType is the type of the JIRA issue.

api.AlertProfilePagerDutySettings.description: AlertProfilePagerDutySettings represents the alert profile PagerDuty settings

enabled.description: Enabled is PagerDuty provider enabled/disabled indicator.

summary.description: Summary is the PagerDuty's event summary.

api.AlertProfileSecurityAdvisor.description: AlertProfileSecurityAdvisor is the IBM security advisor alert profile settings

auto.description: Automatic means the configuration was automatically provisioned by security advisor, and only notes should be created.

credentialID.description: CredentialID is the IBM security advisor credential.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates whether the security advisor settings are enabled.

findingsURL.description: FindingsURL is the URL to which findings should be sent.

providerId.description: ProviderID is the configured providerID (default twistlock).

tokenURL.description: TokenURL is the url from which security tokens should be fetched.

api.AlertProfileSecurityCenterSettings.description: AlertProfileSecurityCenterSettings is the google cloud security center alert profile settings

credentialId.description: CredentialID is the Security Center authentication credentials id.

sourceID.description: SourceID is the google cloud security center organization source ID (used to construct security advisor findings).

api.AlertProfileSecurityHubSettings.description: AlertProfileSecurityHubSettings is the AWS security hub alert profile settings

accountID.description: AccountID is the AWS account ID.

credentialId.description: CredentialID is the SecurityHub authentication credentials id.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates whether the security hub settings are enabled.

api.AlertProfileServiceNowSettings.description: AlertProfileServiceNowSettings represents the ServiceNow provider alert profile settings

assignee.description: Assignee is the ServiceNow user to whom will assign ServiceNow incidents\items.

assignmentGroup.description: AssignmentGroup is the ServiceNow group of users handling security incidents.

auditPriority.description: AuditPriority is the priority at which to set audit alerts in security incidents.

credentialID.description: CredentialID is the ServiceNow authentication credentials id.

enabled.description: Enabled is the ServiceNow provider enabled/disabled indicator.

project.description: Project is the name of the prisma compute project that was used to generate this configuration. It's required as secondary consoles do not store their project name.

securityIncidentBaseURL.description: SecurityIncidentBaseURL is the ServiceNow address, used to send security incidents.

vulnerabilityEndpointUrl.description: VulnerabilityEndpointURL to report ServiceNow vulnerabilities, customer defined scripted REST API, see: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/orlando-application-development/page/integrate/custom-web-services/concept/c_CustomWebServices.html.

api.AlertProfileSlackSettings.description: AlertProfileSlackSettings represents the alert profile Slack settings

api.AlertProfileSplunkSettings.description: AlertProfileSplunkSettings represents the alert profile Splunk settings

enabled.description: Enabled is Splunk provider enabled/disabled indicator.

json.description: Json is the custom json we send to Splunk.

sourceType.description: SourceType is the alert source type.

url.description: URL is the Splunk HTTP event collector URL.

api.AlertProfileWebhookSettings.description: AlertProfileWebhookSettings represents the alert profile Webhook settings

caCert.description: CACert is the certificate used to verify the server.

credentialId.description: CredentialID is the id of the basic authentication credential.

enabled.description: Enabled is Webhook provider enabled/disabled indicator.

json.description: Json is the custom json we send to the url.

api.AlertRule.description: AlertRule represents the configuration of an alert type

allRules.description: AllRules controls whether an alert is sent out for audits on all policy rules.

enabled.description: Enabled controls whether the rule is enabled.

rules.description: AssociatedRules defines the specific rules whose audits will generate alerts (relevant only if AllRules is false).

api.AlertSettings.description: AlertSettings are the global alert settings

aggregationPeriodMs.description: AggregationPeriodMs is the alert aggregation period in milliseconds.

securityAdvisorWebhook.description: SecurityAdvisorWebhook is a webhook for IBM security advisor alert wizard, used to authenticate the wizard with the console and to pull data.

api.AuthType.description: AuthType is the user authentication type

api.AuthenticationRequest.description: AuthenticationRequest is the required user input for authentication requests

password.description: Password is the password used for authentication.

token.description: Token is the Prisma JWT token used for authentication.

username.description: Username is the username used for authentication.

api.CortexApp.description: CortexApp identifies a Cortex application (there are several)

api.DefenderInstallScriptOptions.description: DefenderInstallScriptOptions holds the parameters for defender install script download

port.description: Port is the communication port between the defender and the console.

api.InitStatus.description: InitStatus returns whether the console is initialized (i.e., if initial user/password is set)

initialized.description: Initialized indicates whether the console is initialized.

api.JIRADynamicField.description:
JIRADynamicField represents a value that can be given as a string or as a dynamic label
See more: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-2-issue-post

labels.description: Labels are the dynamic labels of which the value is based on.

name.description: Name is the static string field.

api.JIRADynamicLabels.description: JIRADynamicLabels represents JIRA labels that can be given as strings or as a dynamic label

labels.description: Labels are the dynamic labels of which JIRA labels are based on.

names.description: Names are the static strings field.

api.LicenseRequest.description: LicenseRequest is a request to setup a new license

api.PagerDutyAlertSeverity.description: PagerDutyAlertSeverity is the severity of an alert triggered in PagerDuty

api.Permission.description:
Permission represents a user or group's permission to access a specific resource.
Currently supported resources are:
- Project - Access to a specific project (if empty, the Master Project by default)
- Collection - The set of collections in the project that may be accessed (all if empty)
If no permissions are assigned, all projects and collections may be accessed

collections.description: List of collections the user can access.

project.description: Names of projects which the user can access.

api.Permissions.description: Permissions is a list of permissions

api.ProjectSettings.description: ProjectSettings are settings for supporting federated console

master.description: Master indicates that project feature is enabled and that this console is the master console.

redirectURL.description: RedirectURL is the redirectURL for the given project.

api.ResolveFunctionsReq.description: ResolveFunctionsReq represents the parameters supported by the functions resolution API

functions.description: Functions is the list of functions to evaluate.

api.ResolveFunctionsResp.description: ResolveFunctionsResp represents the functions resolution API output

functions.description: Functions is the list of functions that were resolved.

api.ResolveImagesReq.description: ResolveImagesReq represents the parameters supported by the images resolution API

images.description: Images is the list of image to resolve.

api.ResolveImagesResp.description: ResolveImagesResp represents the images resolution API output

images.description: Images is the list of images that were resolved.

api.User.description: User represents a user in Twistlock

lastModified.description: Datetime when the user was created or last modified.

api.UserList.description: UserList represents a list of users

cnnf.AllowAllConnections.description:
AllowAllConnections indicates if connections are allowed to/from any entity of the specified types
e.g. if inbound contains the type subnet, the entity is allowed to receive connections from any subnet

inbound.description: Inbound indicates if connections are allowed from any entity of the specified types.

outbound.description: Outbound indicates if connections are allowed to any entity of the specified types.

cnnf.ContainerAudit.description: ContainerAudit represents a network firewall audit event

block.description: Block indicates whether the connection was blocked.

count.description: Count is the event occurrences count.

dstContainerName.description: DstContainerName is the destination container name.

dstDomain.description: DstDomain is the destination domain that was queried.

dstImageName.description: DstImage is the destination image name.

dstPort.description: DstPort is the connection destination port.

dstProfileID.description: DstProfileID is the destination profile ID.

labels.description: Labels are the custom labels associated with the target container.

srcContainerName.description: SrcContainerName is the source container name.

srcImageName.description: SrcImage is the source image name.

srcProfileID.description: SrcProfileID is the source profile ID.

time.description: Time is the UTC time of the audit event.

cnnf.EntityID.description:
EntityID represents the ID of each network firewall entity.
20 bits are used. Max legal value: 2^20-1

cnnf.HostAudit.description: HostAudit represents a host network firewall audit event

accountID.description: AccountID is the host account ID.

block.description: Block indicates whether the connection was blocked.

cluster.description: Cluster is the cluster from which the audit originated.

count.description: Count is the event occurrences count.

dstPort.description: DstPort is the connection destination port.

time.description: Time is the UTC time of the audit event.

cnnf.NetworkEntities.description: NetworkEntities represents a list of network firewall entities

cnnf.NetworkEntity.description: NetworkEntity represents a network firewall entity

collections.description: Collections indicate the collection the entity is part of.

domains.description: Domains is a list of domains.

subnets.description: Subnets are the CIDR format network.

cnnf.NetworkFirewallAttackType.description: NetworkFirewallAttackType is the network firewall type of attack

cnnf.Policy.description: Policy holds the data for firewall policies (host and container)

containerEnabled.description: ContainerEnabled indicates whether container network firewall feature is enabled.

containerRules.description: ContainerRules holds the container firewall rules.

hostEnabled.description: HostEnabled indicates whether host network firewall feature is enabled.

hostRules.description: HostRules holds the host firewall rules.

cnnf.RadarConnectionInstance.description: RadarConnectionInstance is an instance of a connection between two radar endpoints

dst.description: Dst is the dst of the connection instance. Typically kept as an IP or a hostname.

src.description: Src is the src of the connection instance. Typically kept as an IP or a hostname.

time.description: Time is the time the connection instance was added.

cnnf.RadarConnectionInstances.description: RadarConnectionInstances holds the recent connections history between 2 entities (hosts, subnet entities, etc)

cnnf.RadarPolicyRule.description: RadarPolicyRule holds the data of a single policy rule

portRanges.description: PortRanges specify the ranges of ports.

cnnf.Rule.description: Rule contains the properties common to both host and container network firewall

disabled.description: Indicates if the rule is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

modified.description: Datetime when the rule was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or last modified the rule.

ports.description: Ports are the entity port range specifications.

previousName.description: Previous name of the rule. Required for rule renaming.

cnnf.RuleEntityType.description: RuleEntityType is the network firewall rule entity type

cnnf.RuleID.description: RuleID represents the ID of each container network firewall policy rule

cnnf.Subnet.description: Subnet is a network firewall subnet

cidr.description: CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity.

name.description: Name is the given name to represent the range.

coderepos.ManifestFile.description: ManifestFile holds the data of a specific manifest file (can also be of a dependency manifest file)

dependencies.description: Packages listed in the manifest file.

devDependency.description: Indicates if this dependency is used only for the development of the package (true) or not (false).

lastResolved.description: Date/time of the last version resolution. If the value is zero, it means the version is explicit and does not require resolving.

licenseSeverity.description: Maximum severity of the detected licenses according to the compliance policy.

licenses.description: Detected licenses of the dependant package.

name.description: Package name that the dependency refers to.

rawRequirement.description: Line in which the package is declared.

unsupported.description: Indicates if this package is unsupported by the remote package manager DB (e.g., due to a bad name or private package) (true) or not (false).

version.description: Package version, either explicitly specified in a manifest or resolved by the scanner.

coderepos.Repository.description: Repository is the metadata for a code repository

defaultBranch.description: Default branch in the repository, usually master.

digest.description: Repository content digest. Used to indicate if the content of the repository has changed.

fullName.description: Full name that represents the repository (<owner>/<name>).

owner.description: GitHub username or organization name of the repository's owner.

private.description: Indicates if the repository is private (true) or not (false).

coderepos.ScanResult.description: ScanResult holds a specific repository data

_id.description: Scan report ID in the database.

collections.description: List of matching code repo collections.

complianceRiskScore.description: Code repository's compliance risk score. Used for sorting.

files.description: Scan result for each manifest file in the repository.

pass.description: Indicates whether the scan passed or failed.

scanTime.description: Date/time when this repository was last scanned. The results might be from the DB and not updated if the repository contents have not changed.

updateTime.description: Date/time when this repository was last updated.

vulnerabilityRiskScore.description: Code repository's CVE risk score. Used for sorting.

vulnerableFiles.description: Counts how many files have vulnerabilities. Vulnerability info is calculated on demand.

collection.Collection.description: Collection is a collection of resources

labels.description: List of labels.

modified.description: Datetime when the collection was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or last modified the collection.

prisma.description: Indicates whether this collection originates from Prisma Cloud.

system.description: Indicates whether this collection was created by the system (i.e., a non user) (true) or a real user (false).

collection.Usage.description: Usage represents details of a collection being used

name.description: Name of the consumer (e.g., container runtime, username, etc.).

collection.UsageType.description: UsageType represents a collection usage type

common.CloudMetadata.description: CloudMetadata is the metadata for an instance running in a cloud provider (AWS/GCP/Azure)

accountID.description: Cloud account ID.

labels.description: Cloud provider metadata labels.

common.Color.description: Color is a hexadecimal representation of color code value

common.DaemonSetOptions.description: DaemonSetOptions are options for creating the daemonset install script

cluster.description: Cluster is the kubernetes or ecs cluster name.

collectPodLabels.description: CollectPodLabels indicates whether to collect pod related labels resource labels.

consoleAddr.description: ConsoleAddr is the console address for defender communication.

credentialID.description: CredentialID is the name of the credential used.

cri.description: CRI indicates defender uses CRI instead of docker.

dockerSocketPath.description: DockerSocketPath is the path of the docker socket file.

image.description: Image is the full daemonset image name.

istio.description: MonitorIstio indicates whether to monitor Istio.

namespace.description: Namespace is the target deamonset namespaces.

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a key/value node selector.

privileged.description: Privileged indicates whether to run defenders as privileged.

projectID.description: ProjectID is the kubernetes cluster project ID.

region.description: Region is the kubernetes cluster location region.

selinux.description: SelinuxEnforced indicates whether selinux is enforced on the target host.

serviceaccounts.description: MonitorServiceAccounts indicates whether to monitor service accounts.

uniqueHostname.description: UniqueHostname indicates whether to assign unique hostnames.

common.DefenderProxyOpt.description:
DefenderProxyOpt holds options for defender proxy configuration
It embeds ProxySettings but override it's Password field with a simple string
This is needed in order to avoid Secret's MarshalJSON method, which depends on existence of master key file

ca.description: Proxy's CA for Defender to trust. Required when using TLS intercept proxies.

noProxy.description: List of addresses for which the proxy should not be used.

user.description: Username to authenticate with the proxy.

common.Effect.description: Effect is the effect that is used in the CNNF rule

common.ExternalLabel.description: ExternalLabel holds an external label with a source and timestamp

sourceName.description: Source name (e.g., for a namespace, the source name can be 'twistlock').

timestamp.description: Time when the label was fetched.

common.ExternalLabelSourceType.description: ExternalLabelSourceType indicates the source of the labels

common.HostForensicSettings.description: HostForensicSettings indicates how to perform host forensic

activitiesDisabled.description: ActivitiesDisabled indicates if the host activity collection is enabled/disabled.

dockerEnabled.description: DockerEnabled indicates whether docker commands are collected.

readonlyDockerEnabled.description: ReadonlyDockerEnabled indicates whether docker readonly commands are collected.

serviceActivitiesEnabled.description: ServiceActivitiesEnabled indicates whether activities from services are collected.

sshdEnabled.description: SshdEnabled indicates whether ssh commands are collected.

sudoEnabled.description: SudoEnabled indicates whether sudo commands are collected.

common.ImageType.description:
ImageType is the type of a VM image.
For example, in the case of Azure this is one of marketplace/managed/gallery.

common.NetworkDeviceIP.description: NetworkDeviceIP represents a network device name and address pair

common.PolicyBlockMsg.description: PolicyBlockMsg represent the block message in a Policy

common.PolicyEffect.description: PolicyEffect state the effect of evaluating the given policy

common.PortData.description: PortData is a port of connections with his metadata

protocol.description: Protocol is the protocol used in the port.

deny.description: Deny indicates whether the connection is denied.

common.ProfileHash.description:
ProfileHash represents the profile hash
It is allowed to contain up to uint32 numbers, and represented by int64 since mongodb does not support unsigned data types

common.ProfilePort.description: ProfilePort represents a networking profile port

time.description: Time is the learning timestamp of this port.

common.ProfilePortData.description: ProfilePortData represents a runtime profile ports data

all.description: All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports.

ports.description: Ports is the list of profile runtime ports.

common.ProxySettings.description: ProxySettings are the http proxy settings

ca.description: Proxy's CA for Defender to trust. Required when using TLS intercept proxies.

noProxy.description: List of addresses for which the proxy should not be used.

user.description: Username to authenticate with the proxy.

common.RuntimeResource.description:
RuntimeResource represents on which resource in the system a rule applies (e.g., specific host or image)
Empty resource or wildcard (*) represents all resources of a given type

labels.description: List of labels.

common.Secret.description: Secret contains the plain and encrypted version of a value (the plain version is never stored in the DB)

plain.description: Plain text value for the secret. Note: marshalling to JSON will convert to an encrypted value.

cred.Credential.description: Credential contains external provider authentication data

accountGUID.description: Unique ID for an IBM Cloud account.

accountID.description: Account identifier (e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc.).

created.description: Created when the credential was created (or the account ID was changed for AWS).

external.description: Indicates if the credential is external (true) or not (false).

global.description: Global indicates the credential scope is global, for GCP credential scope is the organization.

lastModified.description: Datetime when the credential was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or modified the credential.

roleArn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume.

skipVerify.description: SkipVerify if should skip certificate verification in tls communication.

url.description: URL is the server base url.

useAWSRole.description: Indicates if authentication should be done with the instance's attached credentials (EC2 IAM Role).

cred.TemporaryToken.description:
TemporaryToken is a temporary session token for cloud provider APIs
AWS - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_temp.html
GCP - https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/creating-short-lived-service-account-credentials
Azure - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/manage-apps/what-is-single-sign-on

cred.UsageType.description: UsageType represents the credential usage type

customrules.Action.description: Action is the action to perform if the custom rule applies

customrules.Effect.description: Effect is the effect that will be used for custom rule

customrules.Ref.description: Ref represents a custom rule that is referenced by a policy rule

message.description: Macro that is printed as part of the audit/incident message.

modified.description: Datetime when the rule was created or last modified.

owner.description: User who created or modified the rule.

customrules.Type.description: Type is the type of the custom rule

defender.Category.description: Category represents the defender target category

defender.Defender.description: Defender is an update about an agent starting

cluster.description: Cluster name (fallback is internal IP).

clusterID.description: Unique ID generated for each DaemonSet. Used to group Defenders by clusters. Note: Kubernetes does not provide a cluster name as part of its API.

collections.description: Collections to which this Defender belongs.

compatibleVersion.description: Indicates if Defender has a compatible version for communication (e.g., request logs) (true) or not (false).

connected.description: Indicates whether Defender is connected (true) or not (false).

fqdn.description: Full domain name of the host. Used in audit alerts to identify specific hosts.

hostname.description: Name of host where Defender is deployed.

lastModified.description: Datetime when the Defender's connectivity status last changed.

port.description: Port that Defender uses to connect to Console.

remoteLoggingSupported.description: Indicates if Defender logs can be retrieved remotely (true) or not (false).

remoteMgmtSupported.description: Indicates if Defender can be remotely managed (upgraded, restarted) (true) or not (false).

tasClusterID.description: TAS cluster ID where Defender runs. This is typically set to the Cloud controller's API address.

usingOldCA.description: UsingOldCA indicates whether the defender client is using an old certificate signed by an old CA for TLS handshake.

defender.FeatureStatus.description: FeatureStatus holds data about defender features

enabled.description: Indicates if the feature is enabled (true) or not (false).

err.description: Error string, if an error occurred.

hostname.description: Name of host where Defender runs.

defender.Features.description: Features is the defender features that can be updated

clusterMonitoring.description: Indicates whether any of the cluster monitoring features are enabled (monitor service accounts, monitor Istio, collect Kubernetes pod labels).

defender.ProxyListenerType.description: ProxyListenerType is the proxy listener type of defenders

defender.ScanStatus.description: ScanStatus represents the status of current scan

completed.description: Indicates if scanning has successfully completed (true) or not (false).

errors.description: List of errors that occurred during the last scan.

hostname.description: Name of the host where Defender runs.

scanTime.description: Datetime of the last completed scan.

scanning.description: Indicates whether scanning is in progress (true) or not (false).

selective.description: Indicates if the scan is for a specific resource (true) or not (false).

defender.Settings.description: Settings is an update request of the defender proxy settings.

admissionControlEnabled.description: Indicates if the admission controller is enabled (true) or not (false).

admissionControlWebhookSuffix.description: Relative path to the admission control webhook HTTP endpoint.

automaticUpgrade.description: Deprecated: indicates if defenders should be automatically upgraded to the latest version.

disconnectPeriodDays.description: Number of consecutive days a Defender must remain disconnected for it to be considered decommissioned.

hostCustomComplianceEnabled.description: Indicates if Defenders support host custom compliance checks (true) or not (false).

defender.Status.description: Status is the generic status state per defender or global

lastModified.description: Datetime the status was last modified.

defender.SystemInfo.description: SystemInfo is the OS information of the host

cpuCount.description: CPU count on the host where Defender runs.

freeDiskSpaceGB.description: Free disk space (in GB) on the host where Defender runs.

kernelVersion.description: Kernel version on the host where Defender runs.

memoryGB.description: Total memory (in GB) on the host where Defender runs.

totalDiskSpaceGB.description: Total disk space (in GB) on the host where Defender runs.

defender.Type.description: Type is the type to be given at startup

defender.UpgradeStatus.description: UpgradeStatus represents the status of current twistlock defender upgrade

err.description: Error string, if an error occurred.

hostname.description: Name of the host where Defender runs.

deployment.CommandError.description: CommandError is the command error on specific instance

error.description: Error is the error in case the command failed.

hostname.description: Hostname is the instance hostname.

projectID.description: ProjectID is instance GCP project id.

region.description: Region is the instance region for AWS or zone for GCP.

state.description: State is the error state in case GCP patch job failed on instance.

deployment.DaemonSet.description:
DaemonSet holds information about deployed defender DaemonSet

address.description: Address is the kubernetes cluster address.

cluster.description: Cluster is the kubernetes cluster name.

credentialID.description: CredentialID is the name of the credential used.

defendersVersion.description: DefendersVersion is the version of the defenders deployed.

desiredDefenders.description: DesiredDefenders is the number of desired defenders.

error.description: Error indicates any related errors found.

hasDefender.description: HasDefender indicates if the cluster has at least one running defender.

projectID.description: ProjectID is the kubernetes cluster project ID.

region.description: Region is the kubernetes cluster location region.

runningDefenders.description: RunningDefenders is the number of defenders running.

upgradable.description: Upgradable indicates if the cluster is upgradable.

forensic.ContainerEvent.description: ContainerEvent holds forensic event information (in flat structure)

allPorts.description: AllPorts indicates all listening ports are allowed.

containerId.description: ContainerID is the event container id.

domainName.description: DomainName is the event queried domain name.

domainType.description: DomainType is the event queried domain type.

dstIP.description: DstIP is the destination IP of the connection.

dstProfileID.description: DstProfileID is the profile ID of the connection destination.

effect.description: Effect is the runtime audit effect.

listeningStartTime.description: listeningStartTime is the port listening start time.

message.description: Message is the runtime audit message.

outbound.description: Outbound indicates if the port is outbound.

pid.description: Pid is the event process id.

ppid.description: PPid is the event parent process id.

srcIP.description: SrcIP is the source IP of the connection.

srcProfileID.description: SrcProfileID is the profile ID of the connection source.

static.description: Static indicates the event was added to the profile without behavioral indication.

forensic.ContainerEventType.description: ContainerEventType represents the kind of event

forensic.HostEvent.description: HostEvent holds host forensic event information

app.description: App is the application associated with the event.

country.description: Country is the country associated with the event.

domainName.description: DomainName is the event queried domain name.

domainType.description: DomainType is the event queried domain type.

effect.description: Effect is the runtime audit effect.

invocations.description: Invocations is the function invocation count.

lastModified.description: LastModified is the modification time of the function.

scanned.description: Scanned indicates if the function was scanned for vulnerabilities and compliance.

tags.description: Tags are the cloud provider metadata tags.

triggers.description: Triggers contain invocation paths for functions.

version.description: Version is the version of the function, or the alias name if it's an alias.

credentials.description: Credentials are cloud provider credential ID's with discovered entities.

regions.description: Regions are cloud provider regions with discovered entities.

serverless.Resource.description: Resource is a single action resources

allow.description: Allow states if the resource is allowed or denied.

condition.description: Conditions contain limitations on resources, such as a specific prefix.

negate.description: Negate indicates that the policy apply to all except the given resource.
Negate indicates the policy apply to all APIs except the given API.

properties.description: Properties are the trigger properties. There may be multiple values per key, for example AWS S3 event types: ObjectCreatedByPost, ObjectCreatedByCopy, ObjectCreatedByPut.

sourceID.description: SourceID is the id of the service instance that caused the trigger. For example AWS S3 bucket ARN, AWS apigateway ARN, etc.

serverless.Triggers.description: Triggers contain a service function triggers

triggers.description: Triggers are the function invocation paths from the service.

shared.ActivityType.description: ActivityType is the type of user activity

shared.AgentlessScanSpecification.description: AgentlessScanSpecification contains information for setting up an agentless scan for a group of accounts

autoScale.description: AutoScale indicates that the number of concurrent scanners should be selected automatically.

consoleAddr.description: ConsoleAddr is a network-accessible address that scanners can use to publish scan results to Console.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates whether agentless scanning is enabled.

excludedTags.description: ExcludedTags are the tags used to exclude instances from the scan.

hubCredentialID.description: HubCredentialID is the ID of the credentials in the credentials store to use for authenticating with the cloud provider on behalf of the scan hub account. Optional.

scanNonRunning.description: ScanNonRunning indicates whether to scan non running instances.

scanners.description: Scanners is the number of concurrent scanners to perform the scan (when auto-scale is off).

securityGroup.description: SecurityGroup is the security group that scanners should use (for isolation and internet access). Default is empty value to use the cloud account default security group.

shared.AlertThreshold.description:
AlertThreshold is the vulnerability policy alert threshold
Threshold values typically vary between 0 and 10 (noninclusive)

value.description: Minimum severity to trigger alerts. Supported values range from 0 to 9, where 0=off, 1=low, 4=medium, 7=high, and 9=critical.

shared.AllowedCVE.description: AllowedCVE is a CVE to ignore across the product

cve.description: CVE is the CVE to allow.

description.description: Description is the description of why this CVE is allowed.

expiration.description: Expiration is the expiration date for the allowed CVE.

appID.description: AppID identifies the app that the embedded app defender defender is protecting.

dataFolder.description: DataFolder is the path to the Twistlock data folder in the container.

dockerfile.description: Dockerfile is the Dockerfile to embed AppEmbedded defender into.

appID.description: App is the app embedded's defender name.

collections.description: Collections are collections to which this profile applies.

container.description: Container is the app embedded container name.

country.description: Country is the source IP country.

host.description: Host indicates this audit if for a host firewall.

msg.description: Message is the blocking message text.

os.description: OS is the operating system distribution.

profileId.description: ProfileID is the profile of the audit.

rawEvent.description: RawEvent contains unparsed function handler event input.

responseHeaderNames.description: ResponseHeaderNames are the response header names.

statusCode.description: StatusCode is the response status code.

urlPath.description: URLPath is the requests url path.

urlQuery.description: URLQuery is the requests url query.

userAgentHeader.description: UserAgentHeader is the requests User-Agent header.

shared.Audit.description: Audit represents an event in the system

accountID.description: AccountID is the cloud account ID where the audit was created.

allow.description: Allow indicates whether the command was allowe or denied.

api.description: API is the api that is being audited.

cluster.description: Cluster is the cluster from which the audit originated.

collections.description: Collections are collections to which this audit applies.

time.description: Time is the backup creation time.

shared.Binary.description: Binary represents a detected binary file (ELF)

altered.description: Indicates if the binary was installed from a package manager and modified/replaced (true) or not (false).

deps.description: Third-party package files which are used by the binary.

functionLayer.description: ID of the serverless layer in which the package was discovered.

shared.BlockThreshold.description:
BlockThreshold is the vulnerability policy block threshold
Threshold values typically vary between 0 and 10 (noninclusive)

enabled.description: Enables blocking (true).

value.description: Minimum severity to trigger blocking. Supported values range from 0 to 9, where 0=off, 1=low, 4=medium, 7=high, and 9=critical.

rules.description: Rules is the list of allowed CVEs.

description.description: Free-form text for documenting the exception.

containerGroup.description: ContainerGroup is the azure aci container group the container belongs to.

createdAt.description: CreatedAt is the time when the entity was created.

defended.description: Defended indicates if the entity is defended.

image.description: Image is the image of an aci container.

lastModified.description: LastModified is the modification time of the function.

name.description: Name is the name of the entity.

nodesCount.description: NodesCount is the number of nodes in the cluster (aks, gke).

runningTasksCount.description: RunningTasksCount is the number of running tasks in ecs cluster.

types.ArtifactoryWebhookRequest.description:
ArtifactoryWebhookRequest is an artifactory webhook request
Artifactory doesn't have native webhook support, instead it comes as a plugin
https://github.com/jfrog/artifactory-user-plugins/tree/master/webhook
The relevant fields in the this struct were reverse engineered from the webhook groovy code and from the fields that were sent by a real artifactory environment

CustomVulnerabilities is a collection of custom vulnerabilities
TBD: this storage usage is not best practice, should be migrate to a 1 document per vulnerability

_id.description: ID is the custom vulnerabilities feed ID.

digest.description: Digest is the internal custom vulnerabilities feed digest.

rules.description: Rules is the list of custom vulnerabilities rules.

vuln.CustomVulnerability.description: CustomVulnerability is a user customized vulnerability

vuln.Distribution.description: Distribution counts the number of vulnerabilities per type

vuln.Effect.description: Effect specifies relevant action for a vulnerability

vuln.ExpirationDate.description: ExpirationDate is the vulnerability expiration date

date.description: Date is the vulnerability expiration date.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled.

vuln.ExploitType.description: ExploitType represents the type of an exploit

vuln.RHELCpeHashes.description: RHELCpeHashes represent the CPE hashes associated with a given Red Hat repository

vuln.RiskFactors.description: RiskFactors maps the existence of vulnerability risk factors

vuln.Rules.description: Rules represents a list of CVE assessment rules (used to determine whether a CVE applies to a given package)

vuln.TagInfo.description: TagInfo is the tag info in a specific vulnerability context

comment.description: Tag comment in a specific vulnerability context.

vuln.TagType.description: TagType represents the resource type of the tag

vuln.Vulnerability.description: Vulnerability is a general schema for vulnerabilities (e.g., for compliance or packages)

binaryPkgs.description: Names of the distro binary package names (packages which are built from the source of the package).

block.description: Indicates if the vulnerability has a block effect (true) or not (false).

cause.description: Additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability.

cri.description: Indicates if this is a CRI-specific vulnerability (true) or not (false).

custom.description: Indicates if the vulnerability is a custom vulnerability (e.g., openscap, sandbox) (true) or not (false).

cve.description: CVE ID of the vulnerability (if applied).

discovered.description: Date/time when the vulnerability was discovered.

fixDate.description: Date/time when the vulnerability was fixed (in Unix time).

fixLink.description: Link to the vendor's fixed-version information.

functionLayer.description: Specifies the serverless layer ID in which the vulnerability was discovered.

gracePeriodDays.description: Number of grace days left for a vulnerability, based on the configured grace period. Nil if no block vulnerability rule applies.

layerTime.description: Date/time of the image layer to which the CVE belongs.

packageName.description: Name of the package that caused the vulnerability.

packageVersion.description: Version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null).

published.description: Date/time when the vulnerability was published (in Unix time).

severity.description: Textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

templates.description: List of templates with which the vulnerability is associated.

twistlock.description: Indicates if this is a Twistlock-specific vulnerability (true) or not (false).

vecStr.description: Textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability.

waas.APIModelID.description: APIModelID is the id identifying a unique api model

waas.APIObservation.description: APIObservation is the API observation deduced from the API model

hosts.description: Hosts are the hosts seen for this API.

images.description: Images are the image names seen for this API.

learningStarted.description: LearningStarted is the start date of learning for this model.

servers.description: Servers are the servers seen for this API.

waas.APIPath.description: APIPath defines the data of a single API path

hits.description: Hits are amount of hits on this path.

lastSeen.description: LastSeen is the date when this path was last seen.

requestData.description: RequestData is the per-method request data for this path.

waas.APIRequest.description: APIRequest represents a single API request and its data

appID.description: AppID is the application ID to which this request belongs.

contentType.description: ContentType is the request content type.

method.description: Method is the HTTP Method of the API request.

path.description: Path is the path of the API request.

protected.description: Protected indicates that the method+path are protected by WAAS API Protection.

queryParameters.description: QueryParameters are the query parameters of the API request.

responseContentType.description: ResponseContentType is the response content type.

server.description: Server is the destination Server (including port and schema) of the API request.

sourceIP.description: SourceIP is the source IP of the API request.

statusCode.description: StatusCode is the response status code.

skipLearning.description: Indicates if API discovery is to be skipped (true) or not (false).

waas.APIStats.description: APIStats contains the API stats that occurred since the last stats dump

forwardedRequests.description: ForwardedRequests is the number of forwarded requests since last dump.

inspectedBodyBytes.description: InspectedBodyBytes are the total request and response inspected body bytes.

interstitialPages.description: InterstitialPages is the number of interstitial pages served.

lastErrs.description: LastErrs is the last errors that occurred, storing up to 20 errors.

maxRequestInspectionDuration.description: MaxRequestInspectionDuration is the maximum request inspection duration (time spent in waas until request was forwarded).

maxResponseSizeBytes.description: MaxResponseSizeBytes contains the max response size.

reCAPTCHAs.description: ReCAPTCHAs is the number of reCAPTCHA pages served.

totalErrs.description: TotalErrs is a counter of the errors that occurred.

totalForwardedRequestsDuration.description: TotalForwardedRequestsDuration is the total request duration for forwarded requests.

totalRequestInspectionDuration.description: TotalRequestInspectionDuration is the total request inspection duration (time spent in waas until request was forwarded).

totalRequests.description: TotalRequests is the number of incoming requests since last dump.

totalResponseSizeBytes.description: TotalResponsesSizeBytes is the total APIs response size.

totalTimeouts.description: TotalTimeouts is the number of timed out responses.

waas.AccessControls.description: AccessControls contains the access controls config (e.g., denied/allowed sources)

alert.description: Alert are the denied sources for which we alert.

allow.description: Allow are the allowed sources for which we don't alert or prevent.

allowMode.description: AllowMode indicates allowlist (true) or denylist (false) mode.

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if access controls protection is enabled.

waas.ActionStats.description: ActionStats contains the WAAS action stats

alert.description: Alerts is the number of Alert actions.

ban.description: Bans is the number of Ban actions.

prevent.description: Prevents is the number of Prevent actions.

reCAPTCHA.description: ReCAPTCHAs is the number of reCAPTCHA actions.

waas.AppProtectionStats.description: AppProtectionStats contains the app protection status statistics

protected.description: Protected indicates the amount of protected WAAS app entities (containers/hosts).

unprotected.description: Unprotected indicates the amount of unprotected WAAS app entities (containers/hosts).

waas.AppStats.description: AppStats contains the WAAS app policy statistics

accessControl.description: AccessControl is the total amount of apps with Access Control policy.

bot.description: Bot is the total amount of apps with Bot Protection policy.

customRulesEnabled.description: CustomRulesEnabled is the total amount of apps with Custom Rules enabled.

dos.description: DoS is the total amount of apps with DoS Protection policy.

waf.description: WAF is the total amount of apps with WAF policy.

waas.ApplicationSpec.description: ApplicationSpec is an application of a firewall instance

clickjackingEnabled.description: Indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled (true) or not (false).

csrfEnabled.description: Indicates whether Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection is enabled (true) or not (false).

disableEventIDHeader.description: Indicates if event ID header should be attached to the response or not.

sessionCookieBan.description: Indicates if bans in this app are made by session cookie ID (true) or false (not).

sessionCookieEnabled.description: Indicates if session cookies are enabled (true) or not (false).

sessionCookieSecure.description: Indicates the Secure attribute of the session cookie.

waas.AttackType.description: AttackType is the type of the attack

waas.AttackTypeStats.description: AttackTypeStats are the WAAS attack type stats

accessControl.description: AccessControl is the count of access control attacks.

apiProtection.description: APIProtection is the count of API Protection attacks.

attackTools.description: AttackTools is the count of attack tool attacks.

bots.description: Bots is the count of Bot attacks.

cmdInjection.description: CMDInjection is the count of command injection attacks.

codeInjection.description: CodeInjection is the count of code injection attacks.

customRules.description: CustomRules is the count of attacks detected by custom rules.

dos.description: DoS is the count of DoS attacks.

lfi.description: LFI is the count of local file injection attacks.

sqlInjection.description: SQLInjection is the count of SQL injection attacks.

waf.description: WAF is the count of WAF protection attacks.

xss.description: XSS is the count of XSS attacks.

waas.BodyConfig.description: BodyConfig represents app configuration related to HTTP Body

inspectionSizeBytes.description: InspectionSizeBytes represents the max amount of data to inspect in request body.

skip.description: Skip indicates that body inspection should be skipped.

waas.BodySchema.description: BodySchema is the request's body schema

contentType.description: ContentType is the content type the schema represents.

waas.BodySchemaChildren.description: BodySchemaChildren represents a set of body schema children, uniquely identified by the body field's name

waas.BodySchemaNode.description: BodySchemaNode represents a single body schema node

name.description: Name is the body schema item name (key for json, tag name for xml).

waas.BotProtectionSpec.description: BotProtectionSpec is the bot protections spec

interstitialPage.description: Indicates if an interstitial page is served (true) or not (false).

userDefinedBots.description: Effects to perform when user-defined bots are detected.

issuerName.description: IssuerName is the certificate issuer common name.

notAfter.description: NotAfter is the time the certificate is not valid (expiry time).

subjectName.description: SubjectName is the certificate subject common name.

waas.CustomBlockResponseConfig.description: CustomBlockResponseConfig is a custom block message config for a policy

body.description: Custom HTML for the block response.

code.description: Custom HTTP response code for the block response.

enabled.description: Indicates if the custom block response is enabled (true) or not (false).

waas.DailyStats.description: DailyStats represents the WAAS daily stats

_id.description: Date is date that the daily stats are relevant to.

inspectedBytes.description: InspectedBytes is total amount body bytes inspected by WAAS.

policyChangeCount.description: PolicyChangeCount is the amount of policy changes for this day.

totalRequests.description: TotalRequests is the total request count.

waas.Dashboard.description: Dashboard contains the data of the WAAS Dashboard

dailyStats.description: DailyStats are the WAAS daily stats.

insights.description: Insights are the current WAAS insights.

waas.DoSConfig.description: DoSConfig is a dos policy specification

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if dos protection is enabled.

excludedNetworkLists.description: Network IPs to exclude from DoS tracking.

matchConditions.description: Conditions on which to match to track a request. The conditions are \"OR\"'d together during the check.

trackSession.description: Indicates if the custom session ID generated during bot protection flow is tracked (true) or not (false).

waas.DoSMatchCondition.description: DoSMatchCondition is used for matching a request for tracking

responseCodeRanges.description: Response codes for the request's response matching.

waas.Effect.description: Effect is the effect that will be used in the rule

exposedPort.description: Exposed port that the proxy is listening on.

grpc.description: Indicates if the proxy supports gRPC (true) or not (false).

host.description: URL address (name or IP) of the endpoint's API specification (e.g., petstore.swagger.io). The address can be prefixed with a wildcard (e.g., *.swagger.io).

http2.description: Indicates if the proxy supports HTTP/2 (true) or not (false).

internalPort.description: Internal port that the application is listening on.

tls.description: Indicates if the connection is secured (true) or not (false).

waas.ExceptionField.description: ExceptionField is used to perform the protection exception fields

waas.ExceptionLocation.description: ExceptionLocation indicates exception http field location

waas.FileType.description: FileType is the type of an uploaded file

waas.GeoData.description: GeoData are the per-country traffic stats

waas.HSTSConfig.description:
HSTSConfig is the HTTP Strict Transport Security configuration in order to enforce HSTS header
see: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Strict-Transport-Security

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if HSTS enforcement is enabled.

includeSubdomains.description: IncludeSubdomains indicates if this rule applies to all of the site's subdomains as well.

maxAgeSeconds.description: maxAgeSeconds is the time (in seconds) that the browser should remember that a site is only be accessed using HTTPS.

preload.description: Preload indicates if it should support preload.

waas.HTTPField.description: HTTPField is used to perform checks on flags and fields

key.description: Key is the key of the field, if exists (e.g. header and cookie).

value.description: Value is the value of the field, if exists.

waas.HTTPFieldType.description: HTTPFieldType indicates type of http field

waas.HeaderSpec.description: HeaderSpec is specification for a single header and its allowed or blocked values

allow.description: Indicates if the flow is to be allowed (true) or blocked (false).

required.description: Indicates if the header must be present (true) or not (false).

values.description: Wildcard expressions that represent the header value.

waas.Insight.description: Insight represents an insight on the dashboard

message.description: Message is the display message of the insight.

waas.IntelGatheringConfig.description: IntelGatheringConfig is the configuration for intelligence gathering protections

removeFingerprintsEnabled.description: Indicates if server fingerprints should be removed (true) or not (false).

waas.JSInjectionSpec.description: JSInjectionSpec is the js injection protection spec

enabled.description: Indicates if JavaScript injection is enabled (true) or not (false).

waas.KnownBotProtectionsSpec.description: KnownBotProtectionsSpec is the known bot protections spec

waas.LogScrubbingSpec.description: LogScrubbingSpec defined a single log scrubbing specification

disabled.description: Indicates if the rule is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

modified.description: Datetime when the rule was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or last modified the rule.

placeholder.description: Placeholder is the placeholder text to replace the matched field content.

previousName.description: Previous name of the rule. Required for rule renaming.

waas.LogScrubbingSpecs.description: LogScrubbingSpecs is the log scrubbing specifications

waas.MaliciousUploadConfig.description: MaliciousUploadConfig is the configuration for file upload protection

method.description: Type of HTTP request (e.g., PUT, GET, etc.).

parameters.description: Parameters that are part of the HTTP request.

waas.MinTLSVersion.description: MinTLSVersion is the list of acceptable TLS versions

waas.MonitoringStats.description: MonitoringStats are the waas per-profile monitoring stats

aggregationStart.description: AggregationStart indicates when stats aggregation started.

lastUpdate.description: LastUpdate indicates when the stats were last updated.

waas.NetworkControls.description: NetworkControls contains the network controls config (e.g., access controls for IPs and countries)

exceptionSubnets.description: Network lists for which requests completely bypass WAAS checks and protections.

waas.NetworkList.description: NetworkList represent network list of IP/CIDR in waas

disabled.description: Indicates if the rule is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

modified.description: Datetime when the rule was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or last modified the rule.

previousName.description: Previous name of the rule. Required for rule renaming.

subnets.description: List of the IPv4 addresses and IP CIDR blocks.

allowEmptyValue.description: Indicates if an empty value is allowed (true) or not (false).

array.description: Indicates if multiple values of the specified type are allowed (true) or not (false).

explode.description: Indicates if arrays should generate separate parameters for each array item or object property.

max.description: Maximum allowable value for a numeric parameter.

min.description: Minimum allowable value for a numeric parameter.

required.description: Indicates if the parameter is required (true) or not (false).

waas.ParamLocation.description: ParamLocation is the location of a parameter

waas.ParamStyle.description:
ParamStyle is a param format style, defined by OpenAPI specification
It describes how the parameter value will be serialized depending on the type of the parameter value.
Ref: https://swagger.io/docs/specification/serialization/
https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.0.md#style-examples

waas.ParamType.description:
ParamType is the type of a parameter, defined by OpenAPI specification
Ref: https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md#data-types

waas.Path.description: Path is an API path information

methods.description: Supported operations for the path (e.g., PUT, GET, etc.).

path.description: Relative path to an endpoint such as \"/pet/{petId}\".

maxPort.description: Maximum port number to use in the application firewall.

minPort.description: Minimum port number to use in the application firewall.

waas.PolicyStats.description: PolicyStats contains the WAAS policy statistics

apps.description: Apps is the total amount of apps in the WAAS policies.

rules.description: Rules is the total amount of rules in the WAAS policies.

waas.Protection.description: Protection is the type of protection

waas.ProtectionConfig.description: ProtectionConfig represents the waas protection config against the attack

waas.ProtectionStatus.description: ProtectionStatus describes the status of the WAAS protection

enabled.description: Enabled indicates if WAAS protection is enabled (true) or not (false).

ports.description: Ports indicates http/https open ports associated with the container.

supported.description: Supported indicates if WAAS protection is supported (true) or not (false).

unprotectedProcesses.description: UnprotectedProcesses holds the processes that support HTTP/HTTPS without WAAS protection.

allSessions.description: Indicates if the reCAPTCHA page is served at the start of every new session (true) or not (false).

enabled.description: Indicates if reCAPTCHA integration is enabled (true) or not (false).

siteKey.description: ReCAPTCHA site key to use when invoking the reCAPTCHA service.

successExpirationHours.description: Duration for which the indication of reCAPTCHA success is kept. Maximum value is 30 days * 24 = 720 hours.

waas.ReCAPTCHAType.description: ReCAPTCHAType is the reCAPTCHA configured type

waas.RemoteHostForwardingConfig.description: RemoteHostForwardingConfig defines a remote host to forward requests to

enabled.description: Indicates if remote host forwarding is enabled (true) or not (false).

target.description: Remote host to forward requests to.

waas.ReqErrorCtx.description: ReqErrorCtx is the request error context

defender.description: Defender is the defender name from which the error originated.

requestInspectionDuration.description: RequestInspectionDuration is the request inspection handling time by the WAAS plugins (time spent in WAAS before forwarding the request and handling the response).

requestStart.description: RequestStart is the request start time.

serveDuration.description: ServeDuration is the total request handling time including forwarding and response until the error.

waas.RequestAnomalies.description: RequestAnomalies is the request anomalies spec

waas.RequestAnomalyThreshold.description: RequestAnomalyThreshold is the score threshold for which request anomaly violation is triggered

waas.ResponseCodeStats.description:
ResponseCodeStats holds counts of different response types
Categories taken from: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status

clientErrors.description: ClientErrors are the codes in the 400-499 range.

informational.description: Informational are the codes in the 100-199 range.

redirects.description: Redirects are the codes in the 300-399 range.

serverErrors.description: ServerErrors are the codes in the 500-599 range.

successful.description: Successful are the codes in the 200-299 range.

waas.Rule.description: Rule represents a single rule that is associated with a container firewall

allowMalformedHttpHeaderNames.description: AllowMalformedHttpHeaderNames indicates if validation of http request header names should allow non-compliant characters.

applicationsSpec.description: List of API specifications in the rule.

collections.description: List of collections. Used to scope the rule.

disabled.description: Indicates if the rule is currently disabled (true) or not (false).

modified.description: Datetime when the rule was last modified.

owner.description: User who created or last modified the rule.

previousName.description: Previous name of the rule. Required for rule renaming.

readTimeoutSeconds.description: ReadTimeout is the timeout of request reads in seconds, when no value is specified (0) the timeout is 5 seconds.

windows.description: Indicates whether the operating system of the app is windows, default is Linux.

waas.SameSite.description:
SameSite allows a server to define a cookie attribute making it impossible for
the browser to send this cookie along with cross-site requests. The main
goal is to mitigate the risk of cross-origin information leakage, and provide
some protection against cross-site request forgery attacks.

See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Set-Cookie/SameSite for details

waas.StatusCodeRange.description: StatusCodeRange represents a status code range

end.description: End of the range. Can be omitted if using a single status code.

start.description: Start of the range. Can also be used for a single, non-range value.

waas.TLSConfig.description: TLSConfig holds the user TLS configuration and the certificate data

waas.UnknownBotProtectionSpec.description: UnknownBotProtectionSpec is the unknown bot protection spec

waas.UnprotectedAppsVulnStats.description: UnprotectedAppsVulnStats contains vulnerability statistics of unprotected web apps

waas.UnprotectedContainersWebApps.description: UnprotectedContainersWebApps contains the result of scanning unprotected containers summary

count.description: Count is the sum of containers using this image.

ports.description: Ports is the open http/https ports on containers using this image.

waas.UnprotectedHostsWebApps.description: UnprotectedHostsWebApps contains the result of scanning unprotected hosts summary

hostname.description: Hostname is the host name.

unprotectedProcesses.description: UnprotectedProcesses is processes that uses HTTP/HTTPs but are unprotected by WAAS.

waas.UnprotectedProcess.description: UnprotectedProcess holds unprotected processes alongside the port

waas.UserDefinedBot.description: UserDefinedBot indicates a user-defined bot and its effect

headerName.description: Header name which defines the bot.

headerValues.description: Header values corresponding to the header name. Can contain wildcards.

subnets.description: Subnets where the bot originates. Specify using network lists.

waas.WebAppsDiscoverySettings.description: WebAppsDiscoverySettings is the web apps discovery settings

disabled.description: Disabled indicates whether web apps discovery is disabled.

wildfire.Usage.description: Usage holds wildfire usage stats, period for the usage varies with context

bytes.description: Bytes is the total number of bytes uploaded to the WildFire API.

queries.description: Queries is the number of queries to the WildFire API.

uploads.description: Uploads is the number of uploads to the WildFire API.

200.description: Groups represents a list of groups
